entries.meaning: (sometimes derogatory) A person who moves from place to place or job to job.
(nautical) A type of lightweight sail used in light winds like a spinnaker.
examples: In winds above 10 knots we usually run wing-and-wing with our 100 percent lapper set on a whisker pole opposite the mainsail. As the wind drops, we get out the drifter and set it flying to leeward (Fig. 1).

entries.meaning: (automotive) A driver who uses driving techniques to modify vehicle traction to cause a vehicle to slide or power slide rather than drive in line with the tires.
examples: However, sensing the available traction may actually be more important to a drifter.

entries.meaning: (parachuting) A parachutist who jumps before the rest of the group to determine wind direction.
examples: As we circled the area, the Dakota appeared and dropped a drifter.

entries.meaning: (mining, historical) A person employed in driving in rock other than coal.
(fishing) One who takes part in drift fishing.
(fishing) A boat used for drift fishing.
